description: A federal judge blocked President Donald Trump from banning transgender people from the armed forces while a lawsuit proceeds, sparing thousands of service members from facing dismissal.
title: Trump’s Transgender Troop Ban Blocked by Judge During Litigation

description: Mexico City lawmakers on Tuesday voted to prohibit harming or killing bulls, reimagining bullfights as “non-violent spectacles.”
title: Mexico City Rebrands Bullfighting With Ban on Killing Bulls

description: The Trump administration dismissed two Democrats on the US Federal Trade Commission on Tuesday, in the latest example of the White House asserting control over US agencies.
title: Trump Administration Dismisses Democratic FTC Commissioners

description: The Trump administration’s placement of thousands of federal workers on leave drew mixed reactions this week from judges who had ordered those employees back in their jobs after they were initially fired.
title: Trump Agencies’ Plan for Fired Workers Faces Judicial Pushback

description: President Donald Trump’s March 15 deportation of hundreds of alleged Venezuelan gang members, in possible defiance of a federal judge’s order, deepened a battle over the limits of presidential authority and the courts’ ability to check the chief executive’s power.
title: What Happens If President Trump Defies a Judge’s Order?

description: The Social Security Administration will add new procedures requiring beneficiaries to prove their identity before claiming benefits or changing their direct deposit instructions, as part of an effort to crack down on fraud.
title: Social Security Will Require Identity Checks in Fraud Crackdown

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Stephanie Lai looks at Chief Justice John Roberts’ unusual response to President Donald Trump. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Justice Roberts Delivers an Unusual Message to President Trump

description: JD Vance will chair the Republican National Committee’s finance committee heading into the 2026 midterm election cycle, giving the vice president entrée to the world of deep-pocketed donors whose support is crucial for any future presidential aspirations.
title: JD Vance Will Lead GOP Fundraising Efforts for Midterm Elections

description: The UK and European Union are in talks to accelerate arms shipments to Ukraine ahead of a potential full ceasefire, Britain’s foreign secretary told Bloomberg shortly before Vladimir Putin agreed to a limited truce.
title: UK, EU in Talks to Accelerate Arms for Ukraine Before Ceasefire

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said the phone call between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin shows that Russia isn’t ready for a ceasefire.
title: Zelenskiy Says Trump-Putin Call Shows Russia Not Ready for Truce

description: Billionaire investors Dan Loeb and Glenn Dubin were among thousands of donors who helped Andrew Cuomo dominate the cash hauls for the New York City mayor’s primary race in the latest campaign finance filings.
title: Cuomo Raises $1.5 Million in Sprint to NYC Mayoral Primary

description: A federal judge ruled that Elon Musk likely exercised unconstitutional power in orchestrating the Trump administration’s efforts to shutter the US agency that manages foreign aid.
title: Judge Finds Musk Role in USAID Closure Likely Violated Law

description: The Houthi assaults on ships in the Red Sea caused the biggest disruption to global trade since the Covid-19 pandemic, subduing activity in one of the world’s busiest maritime corridors.
title: How the Houthi Red Sea Ship Attacks Upended Global Trade

description: A prominent son of former Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro is taking a leave of absence from Congress to live in the US, where he has sought to build Republican support for his father’s legal battles with the country’s Supreme Court.
title: Bolsonaro’s Son Leaves Congress, Moves to US Amid Feud With Judge

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s move to cut disability benefits sets the scene for a showdown with the left of his governing Labour party as he seeks to prioritize fiscal prudence over social policy.
title: Starmer’s Disability Benefits Cuts Set Up Latest Fight on Labour Identity

description: Democratic lawmakers are demanding the US extend deportation protection for more than 500,000 Haitians, warning that without it they would be sent to a war zone the government itself “has explicitly deemed unsafe.”
title: Democrats Warn Against Deporting Haitians to ‘Unsafe’ War Zone

description: US government lawyers said in a defiant court filing that the deportation of alleged Venezuelan gang members to a prison in El Salvador didn’t violate the written order of a judge, who had barred the Trump administration from using a controversial law to do so.
title: Trump DOJ Says Venezuelan Deportations Didn’t Defy Judge’s Order

description: President Donald Trump’s nominee to lead the agency that regulates Wall Street has yet to be confirmed, but the sweeping changes to the watchdog from his temporary stand-in are starting to pile up.
title: Acting SEC Head Remakes Agency Before Trump Pick Confirmed

description: The European Union is ready to talk to US President Donald Trump before making any more decisions on retaliatory tariffs, Ireland’s deputy prime minister said.
title: EU Open to Talks With Trump on Tariffs, Ireland’s Harris Says

description: President Vladimir Putin committed in a phone call with Donald Trump to limit Russian attacks on Ukrainian energy assets but declined to agree to a broader 30-day ceasefire as the US had sought.
title: Putin Agrees to Limit Ukraine Attacks But Won’t Commit to Truce

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada will beef up its military presence in the Arctic through increased year-round operations and a new Australian-developed radar system to detect incoming missiles.
title: Canada Strengthens Arctic Presence With $4.2 Billion Australian Radar System

description: David Lammy retreated from his comments that Israel broke international law by stopping aid from reaching Gaza, after UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer appeared to rebuke his foreign secretary.
title: Lammy Rows Back on Assertion That Israel Broke Law in Gaza

description: US Chief Justice John Roberts said the impeachment of federal judges is “not an appropriate response” to disagreement with their rulings, issuing an extraordinary statement hours after President Donald Trump called for removal of a judge in Washington.
title: Chief Justice Rebukes Trump Call to Impeach Judges for Rulings

description: While President Vladimir Putin says he’d welcome the return of foreign companies that fled Russia over his war on Ukraine, his officials aren’t rolling out the red carpet to them.
title: Russia Mulls Tough Demands on Foreign Companies Eyeing a Return

description: US Federal Communications Commission member Geoffrey Starks announced his resignation from the regulatory agency, saying Tuesday he will step down this spring.
title: FCC Commissioner Geoffrey Starks, a Democrat, Says He’s Stepping Down

description: Executives at the US’s biggest management consulting firms are trying to shield tens of billions of dollars in federal contracts from scorched-earth spending cuts by the Trump administration.
title: Fearing DOGE Cuts, Consultants Try to Woo the Man In Charge of Their Federal Contracts

description: Turkey revoked Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu’s university diploma, potentially blocking President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s main rival from running for the country’s top office.
title: Turkey Voids Erdogan Rival’s Degree, Risking Presidency Bid

description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is planning to meet Tuesday with executives of companies that make infant formula in the US, according to people familiar with the roundtable discussion.
title: RFK Jr.’s Next Targets Are Companies Making Baby Formula

description: Chief Justice John Roberts spoke out against President Donald Trump’s call for the impeachment of a judge who ruled against his effort to swiftly deport alleged Venezuelan gang members.
title: Roberts Pushes Back on Trump’s Judicial Impeachment Calls

description: Chile’s center-right presidential candidate Evelyn Matthei said she wants to slash the country’s corporate tax rate to 18% from 27% as her campaign seeks to hold onto its front-runner status in this year’s election.
title: Chile Center-Right Presidential Contender Wants Business Tax Cut

description: German lawmakers passed a landmark spending package, taking a major step toward unlocking hundreds of billions of euros in debt financing for defense and infrastructure and heralding the end of decades of budget austerity.
title: Germany’s Landmark Spending Splurge Wins Parliament Approval

description: The European Union needs to be able to defend itself in a future confrontation with Russia, Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said as she aims to mobilize hundreds of billions of euros to bolster the bloc’s militaries.
title: EU Needs Surge for Defense From Russia, Von Der Leyen Says

description: France will ramp up orders for Rafale fighter jets for its air force, President Emmanuel Macron said Tuesday.
title: France to Boost Orders for Rafale Fighter Jets, Macron Says

description: Israel ended the Hamas ceasefire with deadly airstrikes across Gaza, days after the US ordered an offensive against the Houthis in an escalation of hostilities against Iran-backed militant groups.
title: Israel Strikes in Gaza Widen Attacks on Iran’s Militant Allies

description: Colombia Finance Minister Diego Guevara is stepping down from his role, according to local media reports, sending the peso down.
title: Colombia Peso Slides on Reports Finance Minister Stepping Down

description: Peru in 2025 is facing its deadliest start of the year on record, with the government imposing a state of emergency throughout the nation’s capital to try to keep criminals at bay.
title: Murders Hit Record in Peru as Capital Enters State of Emergency

description: The UK Labour government said it would save billions of pounds a year by slashing welfare spending, unveiling controversial reforms which have provoked criticism from disability campaigners and divided Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s governing party.
title: Starmer Cuts UK Welfare by £5 Billion, Risking Labour Rebellion

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer appeared on Tuesday to slap down his foreign secretary, David Lammy, for saying Israel had broken international law by stopping aid from reaching Gaza, with his spokesman emphasizing that the government position is that a law breach is only a risk.
title: UK Backtracks After Lammy Says Israel Broke International Law

description: Europe must channel money into its own defense companies rather than spending on American weapons in order to guarantee its freedom of action, according to French Finance Minister Eric Lombard.
title: France’s Lombard Urges Europe to Invest in Own Defense Industry

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said that the underlying economy is healthy and there’s no reason for the US to see a recession, while rejecting the idea of assuring there cannot be a downturn.
title: Bessent Sees No Reason for Recession, Economic Data ‘Healthy’

description: Switzerland’s parliament backed all proposals for regulation of big banks made by the investigation committee into the demise of Credit Suisse, completing a procedural step that will influence the government’s draft law on UBS Group AG capital requirements due in May.
title: Swiss Lawmakers Back Bank Regulation Changes After Credit Suisse

description: The US is pressing Russia to sign up to a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine
title: Russian Crude Flows Hold Near Four-Month High While Putin Stalls

description: The flagship public university campus in Texas has been changing, and the rest of the country might be following its lead.
title: The Future of Higher Ed Is in Austin

description: The M23 rebel group fighting to control eastern Congo wants sanctions against its members lifted before it joins talks that were scheduled to begin today.
title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Demand Sanctions Removal Before Talks Start

description: Estonia’s government agreed to spend at least 5% of GDP on defense in 2026, Prime Minister Kristen Michal said in Tallinn.
title: Estonia Plans to Spend 5% of GDP on Defense in 2026

description: Europe needs to integrate its armed forces and develop a regional command structure in the wake of US President Donald Trump’s foreign policy agenda, former Italian premier Mario Draghi said.
title: Europe Needs Regional Chain of Command for Defense, Draghi Says

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is demanding a suspension of all weapons deliveries to Ukraine during a ceasefire proposed by US counterpart Donald Trump, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: Putin Wants All Arms to Ukraine Halted for Trump Truce

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: US-Russia Rivalry Shows Up in Serbian Turmoil

description: Chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz said Germany’s move to unlock billions of euros in military spending should be seen as a “first great step” toward the creation of a broad European defense community including non-EU nations like the UK and Norway.
title: Merz Says Germany Laying Foundation for European Defense Push

description: Ukraine won’t accept any peace deal that compromises its sovereignty or territory or restricts its ability to join military alliances, Ukraine’s foreign minister said Tuesday, ahead of an expected phone call between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin.
title: Ukraine Won’t Accept Compromises to Sovereignty, Minister Says

description: National security concerns could help the startup chip away at the industry’s global leader.
title: US Drone Maker Skydio Wants to Take the Country’s Airspace Back From China

description: Suspected pirates boarded a Yemeni-flagged dhow off the eastern coast of Somalia, the second such attack in a month.
title: Suspected Pirates Hijack Yemeni-Flagged Vessel Off Somalia Coast

description: President Donald Trump’s tariff campaign is likely to worsen inflation and raise the bar for Japanese companies to invest in the US, defying the president’s aim to lure investment and revive American manufacturing, according to the chair of the Japan External Trade Organization.
title: Trump Tariffs to Raise Bar to Invest in the US, JETRO Says

description: Indonesia denied that veteran Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati is resigning, moving to calm investors after the biggest slump in stocks in more than a decade.
title: Indonesia’s Deputy Speaker Denies Finance Minister Stepping Down

description: The US and India should enhance their cooperation on security and intelligence-sharing under the administration of President Donald Trump, a top American intelligence official said.
title: US, India Boosting Work in Security, Intel Sharing, Gabbard Says

description: South Africa’s two biggest political parties are holding a series of talks to resolve an impasse over the national budget that poses the biggest threat yet to the stability of the country’s ruling alliance.
title: South Africa’s Biggest Parties Seek Budget Compromise by April

description: The Trump administration could slap new tariffs on Vietnamese goods as a tool to rebalance trade between the US and the Southeast Asian Country, U.S.-Asean Business Council President and Chief Executive Officer Ted Osius said at a Hanoi briefing.
title: Vietnam at ‘Real’ Risk of New US Tariffs, US Business Group Says

description: German lawmakers will vote on a bill Tuesday that would unlock hundreds of billions of euros in debt-financed defense and infrastructure spending and herald a pivot toward a substantially more expansive fiscal policy in Europe’s biggest economy.
title: German Lawmakers Vote on Landmark Spending Bill: What to Watch

description: Poland is working to bolster online security and talking to social media platforms in anticipation of increased cyberattacks ahead of the presidential election, according to Deputy Prime Minister Krzysztof Gawkowski.
title: Poland Raises Defenses Against Cyberattacks Before the Vote

description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is working to secure a meeting with Donald Trump at the White House, possibly toward the end of April, according to Turkish officials familiar with the matter.
title: Turkey’s Erdogan Seeks White House Meeting With Trump in April

description: Staffers with Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency forced their way into the headquarters of the US Institute of Peace late Monday, resulting in police being dispatched and dueling claims of illegal activity.
title: US Institute of Peace Accuses DOGE of Breaking Into Building

description: For decades, presidents have used autopens to keep up with the relentless stream of paperwork that crosses their desk. But it’s not just a matter of saving them from hand cramps. When the president is traveling, time-sensitive documents – such as bills to keep the government open – need a signature right away, and it’s not always feasible to fly the original documents to wherever the president is.
title: The Autopen: Why the President’s Signature Robot Is in Dispute

description: Chinese authorities have begun looking into CK Hutchison Holdings Ltd.’s sale of its overseas port businesses, people familiar with the matter said, amid signs that Beijing is unhappy that the Hong Kong conglomerate divested its Panama operations under US pressure.
title: China Is Said to Scrutinize Li Ka-shing’s Panama Port Deal

description: President Donald Trump’s move to close the agency that oversees Voice of America and Radio Free Asia has drawn praise in China and Cambodia that have long been critical of US media outlets.
title: Trump Closing Voice of America Draws Praise From China, Cambodia

description: Li Ka-shing’s plan to sell the bulk of his company’s global ports operations to a consortium led by BlackRock Inc. is causing concern, according to Hong Kong’s leader.
title: Li Ka-Shing’s Port Sale Creates Societal Concern, HK Leader Says

description: Thailand plans to halve the number of days it allows foreign tourists to stay without visas to 30 days as the Southeast Asian nation cracks down on travelers exploiting the waiver to engage in illegal businesses, according to Tourism and Sports Minister Sorawong Thienthong.
title: Thailand Plans to Cut Tourists’ Visa-Free Stays to 30 Days

description: Mark Carney held stock options in Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. that were worth $6.8 million at the end of December, but the investment manager’s annual 10-K filing offers little information about how much it paid the man who is now Canada’s prime minister.
title: Carney Held $6.8 Million of Brookfield Options Before Quitting for Political Run

description: Mortgage giant Fannie Mae has added Christopher Stanley, a cybersecurity engineer at SpaceX and social media platform X — who is also involved with the Department of Government Efficiency — to its board of directors, the latest sign of how Elon Musk’s allies are embedding into the federal government.
title: Musk Ally, DOGE Member Stanley Tapped For Fannie Mae Board Amid Shakeup

description: The US added South Korea to a list of so-called sensitive countries for energy cooperation in January after a security breach came to light, according to South Korea’s Foreign Ministry.
title: South Korea Says ‘Sensitive Country’ Label Due to Security Breach

description: From a cramped booth in a crowded conference center on New Delhi’s outskirts, executives from one of Russia’s biggest energy firms made their sales pitch to Indian buyers — take our Arctic gas now, while it’s still cheap.
title: Russia Is Wooing Arctic Gas Buyers With Life After US Sanctions

description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed his government would go after Hamas “with increasing military strength” as Israel launched a series of military strikes overnight across Gaza and a nearly two-month ceasefire appeared to be quickly falling apart.
title: Israel Strikes Targets Throughout Gaza as Ceasefire Frays

description: US tariffs on steel and aluminum are “self-defeating” and Australia merits better treatment, Treasurer Jim Chalmers said, adding the overall economic impact of President Donald Trump’s levies to date would be relatively small.
title: Australia Deserves Better From the US on Tariffs, Treasurer Says

description: China hasn’t imported liquefied natural gas from the US for 40 days, the longest gap in almost two years, as traders are forced to divert shipments elsewhere to avoid Beijing’s tariffs on the super-chilled fuel.
title: China Halts US LNG Imports as Trade War Reroutes Deliveries
